title: Coming in for a conference
text:
Good morning Miami!

So this posting may be a little different than the myriad of other strictly platonic posts. I am not currently in Miami and won't be until I show up for week-long conference in May/June. What I'm looking for is someone I can chat with over the next few months, get to know, and if it turns out we really like each other maybe I can buy them a drink when I'm down there.

This is a strictly platonic section so I'm not looking for anything other than a friend I can chat with about life and maybe get some tips for my time. I'm going to be staying at some fancy pants hotel on South Beach and would love some guidance for the area.

A little about me, I'm a lawyer and college professor. I'm a huge movie buff and love to be outside. I'd like to think I'm funny but at the very least I'm fairly sarcastic and can carry on a conversation. I don't much care what you look like or your marital status because this will be primarily an email/skype/kik conversation.

title: Looking for a mentor / looking for a job
text:
I do not know what and how to say it .It is kind of ridiculous to be at 41 and need to start your life all over again.I am looking for someone (a mentor,a guide whatever you name it) who has ability and good will to help others.

To make things clear I'm not asking for " a fish ...I'm looking for a fishing-rod".


I'm originally from Poland (I've got American citizenship) male with good manners. Honest and educated staying in Poland as of right now. After years in States I moved back to Poland (a year ago) to take care of my elderly mom.
From the perspective (I'm sorry to say that) that was a huge mistake. All of the sudden my brother and his wife reminded themselves that they got a mother and they became so "loving". Under the circumstances my mom has simply changed her mind and she does not need me anymore . Who would it thought that something like this happens but it happened. I still love her and wish her the best.

Now I need to go back to US and start everything from the beginning. In order to do so, first and foremost I need a job and place to stay. Needless to mention that I lost everything when I had decided to move to Poland (lost my job, sold my condo for almost nothing) 

Despite of everything I still believe that there is a plenty people of good will who can help. 

Maybe you are one of them? Or maybe you are the one who needs a help as well? We can help each other?

Although I worked for a corporation I can be a good Companion, House Manager, and Caregiver.
( actually I'm into that type of mojo after that experience at my mom's ). 
I love to cook and housekeeping is not a problem for me. Things come to me naturally and I learn them pretty quick.


So if you feel like you can help please contact me. While in Europe we can comunicate via Skype.

title: White Guy seeks Black Girl for Fun, Friendship and Good Times
text:
Hey! My name is Mike. I just relocated back to the Ft Lauderdale area and I'm looking to make a new friend.

A little bit about me.....I'm 47, divorced, tall, thin, very clean, in good shape, self employed and don't have any kids. I'm intelligent, loyal, honest, trustworthy, reliable, spontaneous, adventurous, very open minded, completely uninhibited, hysterically funny, a little wild and lots of fun! My interests are varied and random, but I like hot wings & cold beer, shooting pool, amusement parks, Dave & Busters, karaoke, horror movies, The Walking Dead, Criminal Minds. live music, comedy clubs, watching interracial porn (not alone), being outdoors and all kinds of other stuff. I drink, smoke, swear like a sailor and sometimes burp out loud, but I always put the toilet seat down, never scratch myself in public and I'm a blast to hang out with! I'm a little immature for my age and find that I get along better and have a lot more in common with younger women. I don't have any specific age in mind, but definitely prefer someone under 40. Darker skinned women are my color / flavor of choice, whether it's as friends or something else. I know this is the strictly platonic section, but I would be open to more, if it happened.

About you.....single/divorced, under 40, AA, Black, Brown, Caramel, Chocolate, Ebony, Islander, Mixed Race, etc (you get the idea), healthy, fit, in shape, intelligent, honest, reliable, spontaneous, adventurous, very open minded, uninhibited, a little wild and definitely lots of fun! Please take no offense, but if you're out of shape or overweight, we will not click. Kids are cool and they adore me as much as I do them! I love body art (tattoos) and piercings, so if you have them, that's a BIG PLUS :)

I am bold enough to post a pic, so if you're interested, please send 1 or 2 with your response. Also make sure to tell me the area you live in and a little bit about yourself. I dislike drama and love POSITIVE ENERGY! Please change the subject line to HI MIKE so I can weed out the spam. Hope to hear from an awesome girl!!!

title: Houseboy or Houseman
text:
Healthy, physically fit, active, good looking, high profile, professional couple (no children) with a large home on the Island in Boca Raton looking for a Take-Charge, Hands-On, Live-In, Full-Time experienced Houseboy / Houseman / Handyman that will have responsibilities both inside and outside of the home.

This serious position requires commitment for the long term. We are looking for that right person that will be with us, take care of us, and our properties for a long time, not just for a few months.

This position requires work both inside and outside our home, including but not limited to housekeeping, laundry, cleaning, car care, driving, gardening, pool care, simple healthy cooking, shopping, polishing, basically anything and everything required to take care of us, our puppy, and our property, thereby making our lives easier and more efficient. Typical Houseboy / Houseman / Handyman responsibilities.

The perfect person for this position is someone who loves to take care of others with attention to detail and who does not want to worry about rent or mortgage payments, food, utilities, and other household expenses. We provide a package that includes All Room, All Board, and All job related expenses paid by us, as well as a monthly stipend and paid vacation after the first year.

Current, clean, and valid Drivers License and Passport is a must, as there will be a Complete Drivers License, Passport, Credit, and Background check for this position. You must be neat, clean, organized, healthy, drug and smoke free, with no illegal addictions.

This position is available immediately for the right person. If you are interested and think you have what it takes, please email us with your current resume, current photo and phone number.

title: Share Live Aboard, Bucket List, Keys
text:
Looking for someone who would be interested in going in on a sailboat??

I am looking for someone to share a boat with. I have moved 2 times in the past two years while in Miami they keep renovation the apartment buildings and going up on the rent. 

I must have a boat purchased by the end of February or I will get locked into another lease. Every time I sign a lease it is 1st, Last and Security, which runs $3,000-$3,500 up front. I am looking for a slower, friendlier, pace of life where people still say hello and thank you if you hold the door open for them. 

I am looking to do a live aboard with someone interesting and young at heart for 12 months and absorb the Keys and Key West for a season without getting in over my head financially. I don't want to be homeless in Key West either as housing in the keys gets pricey!! It is very hard to find a place altogether in Key West. 

Not looking to get scammed by another landlord in Miami. I would like to have money to enjoy things and see Key West nicely and not just exist there. Having a boat and place to put your stuff while seems more stable than renting these days.

I have moved 2 times in the past two years while in Miami they keep renovation the apartment buildings i live in and go up on the rent. I would like to travel down to the Keys....first make it down to Marathon for a month or two then go down to key west once I secure a slip. Not looking to moor and dingy it. Need someone who is interest and able to go in half on a sailboat with me, my budget is $2k and looking for someone who wants to go in with another $2k so really looking to get a boat for around $4k with someone who is flexible and looking for an experience. If you are looking to move around or live on a boat for a while this could be cool. I have some sailing experience. IT WOULD be nice if I found someone with sailing experience.

We can split the cost of the dock, slip in Marathon and then in Key West. I can sign the boat over to you after the 12 months is up. Great way to not have to deal with landlords and expensive rent so you can keep your cash and explore the keys and meet new people.

This is a bucket list that I have always wanted to do. I am a 47 year old male, non-cigarette smoker, and bachelor degree. You please be older, no kids please, college education a plus, no idiots please.

I speak English you should communicate in English as well and have a clean, non-felon background. Background check required, Sorry! We can sign a co-owner contract that we each own %50 percent of the boat and each have a 12 month use of the boat which we both sign. Should have a state issued I.D. and passport.

You should be clean, quite, and well mannered. This will not be a party boat but a place to crash at night, watch sunsets, sunrises and meet people.

If you have some cash to throw in on a boat share, contact me.

Adam
thingsRgreatNflorida
at yahoo.com

I enjoy the female perspective (it softens me) and it's missing from my life and it would be nice to have it back. What I need is a good, female, friend. Someone I can sit on the beach with, or cook dinner with or just hang out with.

It would be nice to have a plus one for some things I do with friends or to hang with me during some of my favorite events or to be your plus one and go to some of your favorite things. No pressure... no expectations... no demands... just really good company.

I own my own tux and I'm not afraid to wear it... but generally I wear shorts and t's or polo shirts. I'm not extreme in any of my views. title: Fun and Cool Boating Girl Wanted!
text:
Here we go; another summer in South Florida when the waters are warm and the sun is hot!

I am looking for a fun and laid back girl that wants to enjoy the summer on my boat. I have a 36' Express Cruiser with all the creature comforts of home including AC and I have a generator for electricity. There are two sleeping areas so if you like, you have a bed of your own.

I am looking for someone to hang out because boating with someone else is more fun. I usually go out for two to three days over the weekends and every holiday weekend.

I like to anchor at Beer Can Island and further south at Marine Stadium.

The boat leaves out of a marina in Dania Beach. It usually takes about 2.5 hours to Beer Can Island. Once there, drop the anchor and relax for a few days.

The ideal person is someone that is familiar with boats, non-smoker, does not get sea sick, and can get away for a few days at a time. If you like to drink beer that's a plus but not a deal breaker. I am 47 years old and looking for someone around this age younger or older. 

If interested drop me an email and let's see how it goes. Please include a photo of yourself.

title: MtF transition support and friend
text:
I need that special someone who will take care of me and revel in helping (and seeing) me as I transform into a beautiful young lady. 

I'm 24, fairly handsome, stand at 5'9, and am just recently discovering my place in the world. I'm extremely fearful of telling my family this, as I'm almost certain they'll kick me out and ridicule me. I have no moral support, I have no friends, and part of that is because I've never been comfortable with myself. I've been a loner for a long time. 

I don't want to come across selfish, but I feel like I'll never live life if I don't become the woman I've always been on the inside. I feel weird expressing myself as a male, with the spirit of a male. I never did before, bit for the past few years it's felt very weird, like I lack confidence. I'm in a very bad situation, and I'm very depressed constantly. My family doesn't feel like family. It's best if I separate myself from them while I transition. 

I'm looking for someone who could be supportive, as a friend. Someone who can help me with a place to stay and with food. I'd find a job after adjusting
and I'll even help around the house in anywhere I can. Doesn't matter where you live, I just need a fresh start to start transitioning, with someone I could trust and feel comfortable around. There's a possibility that it could go beyond just a friendship, but I'd want to start my transition first. Male, female, trans, doesn't matter. I love you all the same. t4m t4t t4mw

Thank you :) I really hope I find someone.

title: Said GOODBYE to my GOVERNMENT job to PURSUE my DREAMS
text:
I'm writing this to share my story and hopefully reignite the desire inside of you to reclaim the dreams you once had and resurrect your passion for life.

I've always felt different, because of my passion for personal development and manifestation, you know all that law of attraction stuff. That's me. 

See, I don't view life the way most people view it and I don't limit my desires based on my current circumstances. And because I've chosen not to live my life by default and truly BELIEVE that my dreams ARE my reality, I'm now a part of an amazing community that empowers others to be who they truly are and live the life that they have always wanted. 

Today, I get to impact THOUSANDS of people's lives from anywhere in the world, as long as I have my laptop and an internet connection. How cool is that!

Are you still reading? Good... So, let me rewind a little bit...

My transformation stared about four years ago. You see, I'd just started a new job with the government, and although I'd prayed to God long and hard for a good government job and he answered my prayers, I was MISERABLE. 

Originally from the Caribbean, my family had a stable upbringing with my dad working long hours to support us- to put food on the table, a shelter over our heads and clothes on our backs. I remember he would always bring home treats for us and he always made time for us. That's what I really love about my dad. I have so many beautiful and wonderful memories of my dad. Yes, my dad passed away seven years ago and I miss him so much. We really never wanted for anything because of him. 
However; seeing the result of my dad working those long hours, I always had the mindset of having my own business someday. 

I joined the military right out of high school because there was not a lot of opportunity there. That is where I met my husband. I remember we would be up talking all night about our dreams, at the time my husband wanted to open a nightclub. Dreaming of a different reality. If only. . .

We were both in the military and we had just started a family. There was no way we could start a business, we had to keep on working. Some years later we talked about opening a restaurant. We tried but was denied a loan. So we had to keep on working, can't slow down because by this time we had three daughters to care for. 

My husband and I eventually separated without either of us realizing our dream of owning a business. How sad. I moved out and now had to take care for the children myself. It was definitely a struggle. There was very little assistance from my husband in helping to raise the children. It was all up to me. I worked a full time job to make sure that all of their needs were met. And as I look back I can say even though there were tough times, we got through them. God got us through some tough times. I was also able to get my undergraduate degree and my graduate degree while working a full time job and raising three beautiful daughters. 

We eventually relocated to Florida where I was able to land a decent job but it was stressful. This is when I started praying to God for a government job. I prayed for years and finally he answered my prayers. When I got the call that I was hired, I remembered that I was so excited, I would finally earn a pretty decent salary along with great benefits. I worked nights, the 6 pm to 4:30 am shift. I said I just wanted to get my foot in the door and didn't really care about the shift. 

Well, I got my foot in the door and started working for the government. Until I learned that it was a very stressful environment and all they really cared about were numbers. They didn't care about the people, the people that worked long and tirelessly for this department. All they cared about was pushing you relentlessly and working you to the bone. It was even more stressful than my old job and it led to my stress related illness. 

I knew about a year into this job that this was not for me and I kept praying for a way out. At this time I still had a daughter at home and now a granddaughter.

I started looking online for something. To be quite honest, I didn't know what I was looking for. I just knew that I needed a change. All of my daughters were adults now but somehow, I didn't have money in the bank and I was struggling. 

I kept seeing senior citizens still working in Walmart and McDonald and it scared me. Even though I said, that's never going to be me. I still didn't have anything saved and it was SCARY. 

This period of financial difficulty was monumental for me. I needed such a rocky period of my life to break me of my "employee-mindset". That was the start of a MAJOR shift in my life. Because I needed to make a MASSIVE change in my life and finally start living my life the way that I wanted to live it. Had I not gone through that financial and health challenge, I may have never considered internet marketing as a vehicle to create wealth. That's the secret I discovered. Before, I was just getting by, trading time for money, now, I discovered a way to create wealth. I found the power of Residual Income by having a business online where I can work just about anywhere I want to, all I needed was a laptop and internet access. f you don't chase your own dreams you're going to wind up working for someone else realizing their dreams. 

I will admit, I faced several obstacles and had some struggles. We all have challenges to overcome when we decide to make major changes in our lives because let's face it I am a baby boomer and was not used to all the ins and outs of using a computer but I learned how to get sales in my business. It was no where near as bad as I thought it would be and I was DETERMINED to make my dreams become my reality. So I worked hard and always had my eyes on the goal of becoming free. 

It was so amazing to me to see how once I made that ONE decision to grasp the opportunity to start a business online, literally EVERYTHING in my life began to shift for the better, financially...

So my inner entrepreneur won and I found a way to generate an income ALL online... and I learned how to have a business and a life at the same time. 

I was able to leave my government job and now I work from home having the Freedom I always craved. 

To some of you that may mean nothing, but for me and my family, that was LIFE CHANGING, I now have the freedom to spend with my granddaughter and make a living online. And that's JUST the beginning!

My unwavering FAITH in my GOD has not failed me and I'm starting to see my DREAMS manifest themselves right before my very eyes. And it's truly an AMAZING feeling!

God has not only financially blessed me, but he's also so graciously brought me out of a very stressful job and has now replaced it with a PHENOMENAL one. 

I can literally work from anywhere that I want and I'm FREE to pursue what I believe to be my true passion and purpose in life...which is to touch your heart with my story, help you to rediscover the true dreams and passions that have been lying dormant inside of you, and show you how YOU CAN be who you truly are, and live the life of your dreams anywhere you want, doing whatever your heart desires.

That is the REAL reason WHY I'm doing this and I WILL NOT stop until I've revived the dreams and lives of as many people as I possibly can. STOP living in FEAR and not only get out of your box but get rid of the box. 

Living in freedom means everything to me because I've seen and know the misery of working a job that you hate just to make ends meet. I know the grind of working hard and getting paid LESS than what you're worth only to have your paycheck vanish before you even get to enjoy it because your bills outweigh your income.

I know the despair of feeling like your dream is too far gone to pursue or that you're too "old" to go after your passion because after all, I am a baby boomer...and it TRULY BREAKS my heart to know that there are still people out there who are suffocating their true desires and have literally given up on their dreams because they don't know how to get back on track to reclaim them.

So I'm here to help YOU and to be of SERVICE to you so that you can finally revive and reclaim YOUR DREAMS. YOU CAN be and do what you want in your life TODAY. You just have to BELIEVE that you can and have a mentor to show you the way.

I'm here to offer you mentorship and guidance if you take the first step. The first step is always the hardest but just do it. Take a leap of faith and join me in my business. 

If you want to find out more information on how you too can realize your dream by working with me then connect with me by replying to this message.

Send me a message and tell me " I'm ready for a change Jackie, I'm ready to realize my dreams please show me how". 

I was once in your shoes and I remember where I came from, so I am not the type of person who thinks she is too good to answer messages and I PROMISE to respond to you. 

Your dreams are waiting for you, when will you meet up with them?

To your amazing success,

~ Jackie


PS: Your life will not change by chance, it will happen by choice. Be bold, reach out to me. I am looking forward to partnering with you. Give me 1 year! You will be amazed at all that can happen in one short year! Choose the life of freedom, choose the life of fulfillment, choose the life where people are going to lift you up, who will speak life into you, and encourage you to get to the next level in you own success.

title: Two Types...
text:
There are two types of people in this world: those who divide people into types and those who don't. 

There are two types: the boyfriend/girlfriend, and the spouse. Some people aren't quite sure which they're attracted to. Pretty much everyone is attracted to the boy/girlfriend type initially, but many are ultimately looking for the spouse type. Among those looking for the spouse are those who don't realize that they themselves, or their significant other aren't spouse material and aren't really attracted to, or cut out for; the domestic lifestyle in the first place. They've just been brought up to see that as the goal, or they aren't being honest with themselves, or they just haven't figured out what they want yet. The most common malady afflicting us is probably fear. With over 50% of first time marriages ending in divorce, and the odds becoming worse with subsequent marriages; the fear seems justifiable. Most people seem to want to go out and have fun with the friend type and eventually settle down with the spouse type. This is a fools errand if you confine yourself to one person at a time. Your chances of finding the right person are close to nil.

Alternative lifestyles are becoming more and more acceptable in our post modern world. Being single is now a much more acceptable lifestyle choice. The stigma associated with it is dissipating. The range has become quite extensive as well, but I've noticed that some lifestyles aren't as acceptable as others. However, the list of acceptable lifestyles does have some overlap, the only difference being terminology. One term is acceptable while the other term isn't. 

Here's a prime example. Those who have chosen to be chaste are looked at as being stuck up, snobbish, frigid, prudish or even as "religious extremists", while the new term which is effectively no different than the former is acceptable. The post modern politically correct term is "asexual". The former term is someone who has chosen to wait until marriage, while the latter term is someone who seems to have been born that way, and is just not interested in sex. I suppose that I belong to the former, but in politically correct society I'll take the latter description because I'd rather just not piss people off over some trivial distinction. When I say "I suppose" I mean that on some level, I could easily fall into the latter category as well because I'm not looking for sex. I'm tired of our culture's obsession with sexuality in all of it's myriad manifestations; its self absorbtions and mental distortions, its physical contortions, its exaggerated proportions, leading inevitably to pervasive and inconsequential abortions. 

So the tactics range from dating one person at a time to "the player". I think that there's a happy middle ground that can efficiently solve a lot of the problems people have with finding who they're looking for. Date five people simultaneously. If everyone were to start doing this there could be a bit of a logistical problem. This isn't going to happen due to this particular activity is still frowned upon. If you date only one person at a time say for a few weeks at a time your odds of finding Mr. Right aren't good. If you date two or three people a week, they begin to improve. Taking it to the next level, date six people every week, or every two weeks, rotating out the duds when necessary. If you have more time on your hands you could double it up with short dates twice a day. This also improves your odds. It's a numbers game at this point. 

It may seem impersonal or "shallow", but are you more interested in what it looks like, or finding Mr. Right? The added benefit is that you are out having fun, and meeting people. You can keep the fun boyfriend guys in the rotation when you want to go out and have a good time, and keep rotating in someone new in your search for Mr. Right. This is the player method, but if you're not having sex with any of them, then what's the problem? It is imperative to note that this only works if you are not having sex with anyone. Personally, I don't even see this as a problem if everyone I'm dating is having sex with someone else. The only exception would be married women, but I don't date married women. 

Traditionally this wasn't looked at as wrong because back in the day, unless you had a ring on your finger you were free to go out with whoever you liked. Nowadays people have this idea that if they are in love then they need to be in a mutually exclusive relationship, but usually one or both parties isn't willing to actually commit to marriage. This is fraud. This is no different than being a player because it is pretending that you have commitment when you don't. The traditional way has it's advantages. It forces people to toot or get off the pot. It required a respectful distance be maintained at all times which carried over into marriage. Now that respectful distance has become obsolete before the second date if not before we know the other person's name. 

So what am I saying? I used to be the boyfriend type, but I'm getting to a point in my life where I don't have the energy to hop from one bar to another partying all night long anymore; not that I did all that much of that to begin with, just that it's really not an option anymore. I'm transitioning into more of an asexual boyfriend type that likes to go out and have a little fun for a while and then take a nap in the afternoon so I can stay up after dark for a few hours with a good book before turning in. 

Being in the asexual camp also has the added benefit of giving me more energy to do the things I really like to do, e.g. biking, hiking, swimming, surfing, sailing, golfing, reading, writing etc. There's some overlap here though because I do a lot of the domestic chores anyways. I take out the trash, wash the dishes, fix stuff around the house etc. I even put the lid down on the toilet. For all you women who think a man should put the seat down, you need to learn that the cupboard door should be closed. The lid should be down, not just the seat. It also has the added benefit of hiding all those nasty stains that we'd rather not look at until we get around to cleaning the toilet. So I'm the guy you want to go out with when you just want to have a good time for a little while without feeling any obligation to have sex, or clean my toilet. This isn't to say that you might not want to have sex with me, or clean my toilet. I'm not in need of these benefits. My plumbing is clean and so is my toilet.

So what am I looking for? A strictly platonic relationship. I'm open to more, but not aggressively looking for more. You're free to date whoever you want and dump me when you find Mr. Right without fear or regret of hurting my feelings. 

Since you should be dating other people you will find that emailing for a while can weed out the people you don't want to waste your time dating. Those who can express themselves in writing will move to the front of the line. A few lines, even a few short paragraphs could be an early warning sign that there isn't much going on upstairs. 

Here's an example of how to weed out the zombies: In Euthyphro's dilemma, there are two horns described; which one do you believe is correct, and why? 

If that doesn't work for you write me a book, or at least something more than what I just posted, and put your favorite place to vacation outside the continental US in the subject line. 

Don't send me a picture unless we've arrived at the point where we think it would be worthwhile to meet. It's not that I don't have a libido, I just don't want it to be what determines who I go out with. I also like some mystery in my life.

Anyone who provides or suggests redirecting their correspondence to another website, email address, facebook, profile page, etc. will be promptly deleted.

About me: 

continuously, happily single
autistically honest
lazy enough to be mistaken for the Unmoved Mover
if you have a problem with procrastination or motivation, you need look no further
open-minded to the point of indecision, if not mystification

You: enough gumption to reply to this ad.

bonus points: * have a clean pool(or something equivalent) with floaty things to lay on.
*an emetic response to tan lines
*intuitively know that the erotic is hidden within the mundane, and that semen is NOT the glue that holds a relationship together

title: Let's start a natural perfumery business
text:
I've been studying perfumery and drawing up a business plan. I realistically have 80% of everything planned out, but want someone to help out financially. I have perfumes planned, but need some R&D still, which is quick. The hardest, and most tedious, part is finding suppliers, so I've taken care of that. I studied methods to spot adulteration, reputations of companies, the structure and nature of the industry, and price norms. I have price spreadsheets made, and this is a highly profitable business venture. I've also planned an extensive line of other natural products (creams, lotions, massage oil, rosacea/acne cures, and natural medicine). I've studied the biochemistry extensively and read through medical journals extensively. My research has been more than adequate to be successful. I'd feel comfortable starting a business with any of products, but perfumes are probably the easiest and have the highest profit margin. All I really need from you is some minor financing early on, and marketing/sales(these things should sell themselves). We can meet up somewhere and talk about making this work; it's tons of fun.

I'm thinking about selling mainly in Brickell and opening up a shop there. A webstore is obviously also in the works.

title: I want to drink a bottle of Canadian Club / have a great conversation
text:
I only posted this in M4F because I had to pick something and women tend to have a better track record with empathy, shared or administered. I am 32 years old and I'm dealing with a heaviness that's difficult to explain. It's not depression. It's more listlessness. I'm not rich, but I live by the ocean. I realize it's unsafe to come here, so I'd obviously go to you. And if I worry you in some way you just don't have the answer the door. 

But whether or not I meet someone tonight, I'm going to sip off a fifth of Canadian Club and listen to music. I know South Florida is weird and there are fewer people here who'd get why I'd want to do that, but my eternal hope tells me someone is out there; someone who'd want to create a shared playlist and sip off the same bottle in the momentary urgency to escape and feel heartened. 

I don't want to do tonight alone. I know it's a risk that's probably not worth taking on your part. But if/when you take the risk, and you sip off the bottle, and we play the music that makes us feel more than our titles. It enriches us, if temporarily. It's nice. It pulls us away from the daily grind.

I hope someone responds to this. I hope there's someone who gets this.

A friend bought a Groupon for an Escape Room outing in Miami for 6 people. She sent out a group message to a ton of people to fill the 6 spots and bam... they were filled without everyone knowing the details. As we started the discussion of when the dates would be, we opted for VD... done. It was then that we realized that the group consisted of 5 girls and one guy! One girl ended up dropping out so we have space left for one more.

I am the guy of the group writing this message. Basically, I have the honor of hopefully telling the story of how on this one amazing Valentine's Day I was locked in a room with 5 women with the only way out being to break out of the room. If the story wasn't good enough, two of them are twins! The awesomeness of this story pretty much writes itself!

Now, add to this story that we ended up recruiting a stranger to be the 5th female from Craigslist! If someone told me this story I wouldn't believe it and would die laughing!

So... Come be part of our story! We are going to do this at an escape room in Miami on VD in the afternoon ($13) and will all go for a drink in Wynwood after. If you have any specifics that will make the story even more comedic we'd love to hear from you and hope you will join in our day of radness!

Write us and tell us a little about yourself as if you are reading it'll be hard to resist the opportunity so we expect a ton of applicants! Can't wait to hear from you!!!

title: Looking for a chill gamer friend
text:
Hey there. I'm looking for a video game buddy around my age (between 21 and 27) that lives near West Palm. To get it out of the way, I am gay and have a boyfriend (therefore ONLY looking for strictly platonic friends). I'm not feminine by any means and am mostly into "guy" stuff like video games, but anyway if you have a problem with any of the above please move along.

Ideally, I'm looking for a local guy that's also a gamer to play online and maybe in person too from time to time. I have a PS4, 3DS, and a modded Wii (over 100 Wii & GC games on it). I do have a full-time job so I'll probably only be able to hang out on some weeknights, but mostly on weekends. If you already have a small (or large) group of other gamers then even better. I drink and am 420-friendly (no potheads though please). If you're looking for the same thing feel free to hit me up.

In your first message please include your gender (though I'd prefer a guy friend I don't mind girls, especially lesbians), age, and interests (other than video games). You don't need to send a picture of yourself if you don't want, though I'll send a picture of me if you do. By the way, I also sing as a hobby and am open to being a part of a band or project, in case you're into that. Last thing, if we do decide to meet I'll need to Skype with you first to weed out fakes (for your safety and mine). Peace!

title: Do you need a father figure in your life?
text:
Hello,
Thanks for stopping by and at least reading my posting.
I want to say first that I am extremely sincere about this.
I want to be a father figure -- an encouraging, supportive, dependable presence in your life. You can tell me how things are going in school, on the job, in your personal life ..
I'll care about you. I will listen, and you will be able to count on me as someone who does care and is interested in how you are doing.
I hope to find a bright, sweet, sincere young man for this unique relationship.
Ideally, you are 18-26, but if you are older yet truly sincere about having a father figure in your life, we can talk.
This is not about money, either, in any way, shape or form. If you think it is, you will be disappointed.
This is about an emotional connection that fulfills your need for a father figure and mine to be a father figure.
I am extremely sincere about all of this, and I hope you are too if you choose to respond. And I hope you do. :)

title: screw valentines

I find it ironic how many of us stress over this holiday due to this feeling or thought of obligation to celebrate it all because society tells us to. What will I get my significant other this year or where will I take them to eat? Then making reservations to restaurants at full capacity or if not waiting for long periods at a time just to have dinner with your loved one and yet still share the moment with all the rest of the sheep that are there doing the exact same thing. How is that romantic at all? Then I read all these ads of single women and men looking for dates because they don't want to be alone on this day. How ridiculos is that concept? So your thought process on this is," I can't be by myself because everyone else isnt?" Some of you are more than likely thinking that Valentines is a special time to show that other one how much you care and spending time with them. Hello? Why do you have to do that one day out of the year? Isn't it much better when someone does something special for you out of the blue all because they're thinking of you and truly love you.

Don't get me wrong, I'm not at all saying you shouldn't celebrate it, however, lighten up about the whole thing. Should you find yourself alone this year then go out with a friend and still have a great time.

title: Randomness, final chapter. Join me.
text:
I'd like to make new friends (around my age) Please read my alone thoughts below. If this randomness resonates within you, I think we'll be great friends, or acquaintances at the very least. 

I enjoy sitting alone. I enjoy me time;going to the movies & stuff by myself. I think I'm pretty awesome company. 

But right now I could be sitting with someone else talking my life stuff like this weird dude next to me (who btw they just sat down 3 feet away from me in an almost empty cafeteria) is to his friend, and listening to my friends life stuff like he is. 

However, upon reflection (eavesdropping) I don't believe I'd be talking about goats milk... as he puts it, he misses drinking out his goats milk spout (or whatever you call it) when he was a young boy in Columbia. I respect that was how you up but come on bro really? I start losing my appetite. 

I look over at the table outside and realize that those two cochinas left all their plastic dishes and dirty napkins on the table. There's a crow picking at the crumbs. 

I then wonder if the crow tries to eat quietly so as to not bring in the other crows and have to share. I think back to the hordes (flock?) of crows eating some I don't know what in front of the publix parking lot. No wait... Those were pigeons. 
Or were they seagulls? 

I wonder if seagulls, realizing that we humans as a species can be pretty disgusting (when it comes to littering) begin to evolve into wanting to eat human garbage only. Then they no longer want to eat fish or whatever the hell they eat. They will then be referred to as landgulls. I chuckle a little cuz let's face it that was a little funny. To me. 

The two dudes next to me give me a wierd look. I guess cuz I literally lol'd and they thought I was laughing at them. I gave them a polite smile and thought, "there are 20 tables up in this bitch mfs. You had to choose the one 3 feet away from me?? ?

Instead, I said, "adios" not because I wanted to but because we made eye contact. 

F@$& this I'm going to Starbucks.

title: Need Partner For Wilderness/Nomadic Survival
text: Hello! My name is Glenn Fredericks. I am a 19 year old college boy from Russia and I don't like where my life is going in this society. I have lived my entire life, since I was two years old, in the same 5 mile or so area of Miami and I have very rarely travelled. I am a total introvert, but people say that I'm also very nice. Nothing in my life would make me happier than being in the wilderness and using my own knowledge to keep my life going. Of course, I plan on bringing with me a fancy computer and my cell phone but in terms of going at it barebones, I don't have enough survival experience to be able to make it out there alone. But what I do have is dedication, a decent amount of emergency funds, a personal car, and even some knowledge of psychology for when morale gets low. I hope to embark on a life-changing journey during which I will learn many things and meet many people. If you are interested in being one of those people, please contact me. I would prefer someone who is close to my own age, but if you are an older man/woman willing to be patient and teach a silver spoon Miami kid the roots of human survival, then you are welcome with open arms. No experience like me is also fine, so if you are a city person who thinks similar to me, this is your chance to escape. One of the main reasons I want to leave for this journey is to feel completely free. So if you are uptight and would frown upon drug/alcohol use and being in each other's company for an unknown amount of time, than this is not for you! You must be willing to talk on video call for little on Skype before the trip.

title: Cooper City/Hollywood Friend
text:
Mature friend 40+ yrs old or older wanted- please be in the Cooper City/Hollywood area

About Me:
30 years of age, Caucasian, 5'3...I am a bit of an introvert with no friends but it would be really nice to have at least one genuine friend to do things with...My "friends" growing up were always adults so that's what I am most comfortable with- older people. I am an old soul & a hippie at heart, a free thinker and not a sheep who lives among the masses out here that look for approval from others.I am far from being immune to the bullshit around me and the bullshitters. I am sympathetic towards others and very family oriented... I am a simple woman originally from the Pacific NW & have yet to find someone who isn't shallow, materialistic or judgmental. 

Professionally I work from home and have children, was married for several years but now divorced. My escape from reality is working out which I do 6 days a week; cardio & weight lifting. I would like to join another gym so we can attend a fitness class together, learn MMA, go to the movies, listen to classic rock, see a comedy @ the Improv or escape for a couple days to Disney. What we do really doesn't matter. How genuine the friendship is what's most important. When I am not working I like to garden and learn about being self sufficient, read true crime books, 420, swimming, nature and road trips. I listen to most kinds of music, depends on what my mood is. 

About You:
Open minded & non-judgemental, little to no drama in your life. Even though I am a great listener and can be a therapist of sorts, I also would like a girlfriend who has her life together, a job or an income and a vehicle for getting around. 

Please respond w/ Friend in the subject line if you're interested and a message worth reading :-))

title: Looking for New Friend
text:
Hello,

If you're open to making a new platonic (non-sexual) friend, you may have read the right post! Would prefer a couple of e-mails and a phone conversation before meeting. 

A bit of a homebody (though improving) work part-time and am involved in volunteer work. Thought having a local friend would make life more fun. Most of my friends are out-of-state. 

They have said of me; funny at times, insightful, lived an unorthodox life (worked many occupations) down to earth, compassionate, and not too embarrassing to be with in public. 

I have many common interests including; movies, music, museums. Also a big public radio listener with great programing in the; arts, sciences, technology, psychology, culture, law and of course, NPR & Prairie Home Companion, "It's a quiet day in Lake Wobegon". 

Still somewhat a holdover from the New Age movement; holistic health, environment, living a purposeful life, helping others, and spirituality. 

If any of this sounds interesting, I'd enjoy hearing from you.

Be well.

For starters, I am NOT the typical South Florida guy and I pride myself on being anything but "normal".

I stay true to who I really am for the positive and the negative while beating to my own set of drums; snare and tom-tom!

In regards to my attitude, my censorship filter is either turned off or usually broken! 

On the flip side, I also contain a silly, playful, dorky personality & sense of humor with such sayings as you put the Ground Control to Major Tom in my former David Bowie!

My definition of having a good time is going for dinner, feeding the duckies, nature watching, sleepovers, Netflix nights, Starbucks for tea/coffee, working out, mini golf, bowling, playing pool, card games, star gazing, video games (PC, iPhone, iPad, and Android), Lion Country Safari, and Jungle Island (Parrot Jungle).

What I am doing with my life

I own my computer consulting business and have been doing so for ten years. In addition to this, I have been busy learning new computer concepts and self-improving on who I am to myself or others. I am basically going through my own renaissance and looking for a girl who wants to come along for the ride.

I'm really good at

I pride myself on being an amazing giver and show by my actions how I put people on the proverbial pedestal. In addition to this, I also possess the ability to logically find a problem and discover a rational solution in life, people, or computers. I also excel in giving my car weekly baths and making awesome mix mp3 CDs! Furthermore, I believe in giving to others that are less fortunate than I am. Two perfect examples is that I provide to the American Red Cross when natural disasters strike and the Salvation Army sees my old belongings on a periodic basis. Lastly for now, I am a big believer in saving whatever resources are left for others and future generations. Therefore, newspaper, magazines, plastic, steel, cardboard all go in the recycling bin!

The first things people usually notice about me

The t-shirts that I wear along with my stereo bluetooth headset. I also am outspoken and uncensored in my personality which means I am not afraid to shake things up. I do what makes me happy and I am the guy playing Angry Birds or Tiny Wings on my iPhone while everyone else is getting wasted while watching sports.

My favorite books are anything computer or self-improvement related. I even read the newspaper and the comics!

Movies can range from comedies to sci-fi and action. Some of my favorites are Austin Powers, Star Wars, Star Trek, Ice Age, Transformers, and Indiana Jones.

TV Shows - I like watching Animal Planet, Discovery Channel, and National Geographic. I also like my variety with Family Guy, South Park, Salem, Silicon Valley, Boondocks, Extant, Shaun The Sheep, The Goldbergs, True Blood, Orange is the new Black, Blunt Talk, Into the Badlands, Supergirl, F is for Family, and even wrestling.

In regards to music, I am a very big fan and it revolves around my life! I listen to mostly alternative rock, punk, and ska. Yet, I do vary my genres with dance, house, booty, techno, jazz, 80s, rap, disco, oldies, and classical.

Some of my favorite bands and artists I'm listening to currently are the following: Green Day, Rihanna, Chris Brown, Christina Perri, AC/DC, Adele, Evanescence, Taylor Swift, Three Days Grace, No Doubt, Linkin Park, Nicki Minaj, Bruno Mars, Flo Rida, Simple Plan, Trey Songz, Soundgarden, The Script, Gym Class Heros, Karmin, Lifehouse, Ke$ha, Incubus, Volbeat, Staind, Maroon 5, Alanis Morissette, Offspring, Katy Perry, Seether, Olly Murs, Cher Lloyd, Lenny Kravitz, Rita Ora, Chevelle, Foo Fighters, Pearl Jam, Five Finger Death Punch, Nickelback, David Guetta, Far East Movement, Carly Jepsen, Britney Spears, Robin Thicke, Daft Punk, Bullet For My Valentine, Hardwell, Van Halen, Nirvana, Imagine Dragons, Disturbed, Sublime, Theory of a Deadman, Three Days Grace, Walk The Moon, Janet Jackson, Coldplay, Beck, and many more!

Message me if you can handle a guy who will tell it to you like it is, prove who I am by my actions, and won't play mind games with you. 

I also don't drink, smoke, or do drugs. Likewise, I also expect you not to smoke or do drugs. Yet, I will tolerate drinking in moderation. 

Reply to me if you're big into positive change, self-improvement, and bettering your life to others around you. 

In addition to this, seek me out if you like animals, nature, and pets. 

If you're willing to prove by your actions and not your words that you're the person you claim to be, then you have my interest. 

Come my way if you are looking for your best friend in good times and bad!

In terms of me,

I'm Caucasian, handsome, single, no kids, never been married, live on my own, employed, educated, and intelligent.
I don't drink, smoke, or do drugs
I have brown thick short hair
Blue/green eyes and I wear glasses

If you already have children, I am kid friendly!

I have no preference for ethnic background; we are all the human race.

I am Jewish but also not very religious; so it doesn't matter whether you're Jewish or not.

I desire a lady who has an outgoing personality and can easily express herself (without thinking the world revolves around her). Shy females need not apply!

Our first meeting and what we would engage in? What I desire in a woman? Get that far with me and you'll find out!

I have enclosed a picture of my bedtime wooly light friend to show that the sheep is for real and so am I.

What I REQUIRE from you on the first email or Kik chat in order to get any type of response from me is your name, age, pictures of you (no sunglasses), what city you live in, what we specifically have in common, why you would be a great person to have in my life, what attracted you to my ad, how you put a someone else on the proverbial pedestal, & what you're looking to ultimately find on CL.

Once you provide these requirements in the above sentence, I will then voice verify you're actually female and really interested. 

After this is accomplished, we can then talk about my pics, webcamming, meeting, hanging out, and chilling.


BE IN DECENT PHYSICAL SHAPE! 

If you're a candidate to be on The Biggest Loser, I'm NOT interested!


NO smokers or drug users! I have no problem with you drinking in moderation.

I REQUIRE from you without exception to put Miley & Nicki need to kiss and make up in the subject area so I know you're actually paying attention. 

I am anti-wooing (unless you're Ric Flair) and anti-chasing.

I'm on CL looking for SINGLE WOMEN that desire meaningful friendships and hangout buddies.

Chat me on Kik - sheepythenightlight - you will be held to my list of requirements if you chat me on there. 

I am only interested in ladies that live in Palm Beach or Broward counties!

SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY!

title: Pastry chef / Baker seeks to relocate
text:
Hello & Greetings to you all! - 
I am relocating to Miami. I am male, 53 years. Healthy, active, non smoker, ( but, 420 friendly ). I tend to spend most of my time out of doors, when not at work. I am, a baker/ pastry chef, by trade. I am also a part time photographer / writer. I am seeking a rental situation, either a place of my own, or a share,with another male; ( temp. share, or permanent, if a good, symbiotic relationship ensues.). Preferably with separate baths. I am a naturist, through and through, ( all of my life ), and therefore am seeking a place whereupon I am able to live out as I am, comfortably. I have no pets. I cook more at home, than going out. I keep a clean house. I am quiet, with a voracious social appetite, for the most part, ( I will admit, if possible, I sometimes, care to crank the music up! ). I enjoy hitting the town for night life, as well as scoping out the local farmers markets, brew pubs, museums, parks, beaches, et cetera,..I can also be a homebody at times. I am open minded. Seeking a male house mate that enjoys music, likes to laugh at life, may practice yoga.. I have a bit of a stipend and savings to survive on, until at which time, I find suitable employment, ( have already begun the sending out of resumes, with a few responses ). I am, amiable, considerate, liberal, decent. On my days off, sometimes, I will just head out and be alone, to decompress from the week. I like to watch a few shows on the telly, or if needed, simply on the internet. -- (Anyone have a house with a pool, or, near the water? ). I also prefer not to live with one that smokes cigarettes as I am asthmatic. I am also on a journey of eliminating meat from my diet, ( just my thing, not anything that I would expect from another ). I do not care for apartment buildings, per se, unless they are well insulated, and not a huge building. ( a house, or a cottage is preferable, in a reasonably quiet, safe area ). Am also open to a barter situation.

Well, I think I may have covered it all. I hope to hear back, as I am keen on beginning another new chapter in my life. 

Have a great, blessed day.

I trust you're passionate about your interests and life choices, please tell me of one? I was (still am, I suppose) an offshore sailor. I love the arts, museums, opera and even ballet (esp. Alvin Ailey). All are cool, but live theater is my favorite.

Be respectful and tolerant and while witty cynicism goes a long way to communicate and entertain, please don't be someone who has brought it home as a permanent guest and extols it as an endearing personality characteristic--it's not. 

The phrase that best describes me is a 'renaissance type.' I've traveled, sailed and done corporate startups; I've seen much and done a lot which hopefully means I'm entertaining.

You should be an avid social and political observer and as you follow silly season events like national debates please be one who rejects those who cannot articulate a paragraph much less a complete sentence, however entertaining 'he' might be. [We can discuss the virtue of tolerance later.]

Thank you if you've read this far; if you do respond please put the name of your favorite literary heroine in the subject line? For example, Lady Macbeth or Madame Bovary (well, let's hope neither of them).

title: Longtime Cure fan
text:
Once upon a time, I was a bona fide black-lipstick wearing, Doc-Marten-boots-stomping, cape-donning, eyeliner-fiending Cure fan and general gargoyle.

I don't spend much time on maintaining any sort of goth attire anymore, as my time and energy go towards other things most of the time. But I think I still have the taste and sensibility for appreciating the twilight realms, especially in terms of music. However, I have not kept up on The Cure, apart from occasionally listening to the older, familiar works I have always loved so much.

There's a Cure tribute coming up next weekend in Miami. Any fellow Cure fan want to go with me?
Since moving to the area some years ago, I haven't been around the music scene much, and I don't know anyone who shares my music tastes. I generally don't have much time to go out because of work-related demands, but I'm determined to make the effort for this event.

I'm pretty harmless and friendly, if boring and underwhelmingly plain, and in my 30s, female, and on the quiet and bookish side. I'm not looking for more than checking out this Cure tribute event and enjoying the sonic memories, but it's always great to meet people with similar music taste. It doesn't happen very often since I've moved here to Florida. I think it's plus if you're old enough to actually remember digging the music when it wasn't yet considered "retro"...

We can email/talk, and meet ahead of the event too if you would like.

Please just be patient with my replies, as I don't have much free time throughout a day to write a lot of email, but when I do, I try to spend enough time writing thoughtful replies. Thank you!

Cheers

title: What is the Purpose?
text:
What is the purpose of continuing everyday?
What is the point when the one you love pushes you away?

What more is there?

We are here to connect with each other as humans, as spirits, as souls. 

But when you have 149 "friends" and not one of them really knows YOU, what real connections have you made? 

I have worked and worked to become what he wants, to become what they want. What I want is not good enough, not strong enough. I am weak. I am not able to become what is required. 

I have failed. 

What purpose do I have now?

I am incapable of reproducing. I am overweight. I have depression. I am rarely happy. 

But I need connections too. 

As humans, we crave that connection to another. We are social creatures by nature. No one can live in solitude. The ones on the streets, even they form alliances and groups. 
In all actuality, they probably have made more real connections than the rest of the "privileged" population. 

I hate myself, and the way I have become. 

I don't like being depressed and down. I miss how I used to be happy. 

I miss my love, and our afternoons.

I miss the way we used to be.

title: What is the Purpose?
text:
What is the purpose of continuing everyday?
What is the point when the one you love pushes you away?

What more is there?

We are here to connect with each other as humans, as spirits, as souls. 

But when you have 149 "friends" and not one of them really knows YOU, what real connections have you made? 

I have worked and worked to become what he wants, to become what they want. What I want is not good enough, not strong enough. I am weak. I am not able to become what is required. 

I have failed. 

What purpose do I have now?

I am incapable of reproducing. I am overweight. I have depression. I am rarely happy. 

But I need connections too. 

As humans, we crave that connection to another. We are social creatures by nature. No one can live in solitude. The ones on the streets, even they form alliances and groups. 
In all actuality, they probably have made more real connections than the rest of the "privileged" population. 

I hate myself, and the way I have become. 

I don't like being depressed and down. I miss how I used to be happy. 

I miss my love, and our afternoons.

I miss the way we used to be.

title: Midwest MWM seeks female friend in FL
text:
Let me start by saying that I'm 43 years old and (mostly) happily married with kids. I work in a big city far from you, have a long commute and struggle to find time to spend with my family, so that's my priority when I'm home. Having said that, I do find the wake-train-work-kids-sleep-repeat cycle wears on me sometimes and I find myself craving a break from my reality. I'm thinking having an email/text/kik buddy to share life's ups and downs or just talk about whatever comes up would provide just that sort of mental break from everyday life. I am not looking to have an affair, emotional, virtual or physical. I'd love to find a good friend that's just for me and a place to go to discuss whatever I need or want to with no judgement or pretense. Out of necessity this friendship will be a secret, I wouldn't expect my wife to understand and she would naturally be concerned. 

I am posting in south Florida because I have a business trip to the are in a few weeks and thought that if I found a new friend we could actually meet in person. I may even extend a day on either side of the trip if I had a good reason. 

I'm not quite how to get this started but I'm open to friends any sort, though I think a female most definitely fits best for this purpose. However, age, race, looks and status are of no importance for this purpose. Most importantly I'd like my new buddy to be mature (most of the time, ha!) and able to hold up their end of a grown up conversation.

I think I should probably give you a quick look into my makeup so you can make an educated decision whether to take a leap and send a reply. I've thought some about how to do that but settled on a simple stream of consciousness, forgive me if it seems random and a bit trivial, but it's the best I can do here:

I love to read and my library card is one of my prize possessions
Some of my best childhood memories involve trips to the library with my mom. 
I take my boys to our library frequently and hope they'll have some of those same great memories.
I've grown a little more adventurous with food as I've aged and had a chance to travel. Though I still refuse to eat certain basics that you will find strange. 
My boys are my world and I take very seriously the responsibility of raising them. 
I desperately hope I'll be able to help mold them into responsible, respectful, kind, compassionate yet independent and strong young men. 
My favorite thing is to coach them in their various park district sports. Those practices and games are the most fun I have these days. 
I work in finance and have a somewhat stressful job and long commute. It is rewarding at times but also the source of my biggest regret, the time that it takes me away from home. 
Even though I work in finance, math has always been a weakness. I work hard not to let that show. 
I spend an hour + each way on the train and hope my new buddy will help me fill that time with some interesting conversation. 
I try to be transparent and do my best not to judge others and I'm almost impossible to offend. 
Im organizationally challenged at times and as a result can seem non responsive or unconcerned with timeliness or deadlines. I'm working on that. Ha! 

That's probably enough for now. If you've managed to get through this entire post and still have some interest, please send a reply! I'm happy to provide a pic (face only, I promise!) if you would be interested. 

Thanks for reading (if you made it all the way down here!) and it would be great to hear more about you if you choose to reply.

title: Russian 30 yo woman looking for friends
text:
Hello everyone! 

I'm Russian, 30 yo, new to South Florida.

Looking to meet cool, interesting people if any gender. 

Usually I'm not much into online meeting thing but, this is a bit different and why not, right? 
Friends should be a "good fit " as well as romantic relationships and maybe even more so. Most good friendships last a lifetime and for sure outlast many romantic relationships. 

Friend is a strong word, just like love. I believe I am blessed to have a few totally awesome friends - but they are left in NYC where I lived for most of my life. I hope to make some here too.

Here is a bit about me:

I like to approach life in un-ordinary ways. 

I love Florida so far. 

I work in mental health.

I'm not much into clubs.

I'm not much into drinking ether. 

I love photography. Had a small photo business far a while in NYC. 

I'd say I'm health nutty. 
I try not to eat meat (even though I don't consider self a vegetarian).

I attempt to work out and do yoga and such. Actually if you do and can motivate me that would be awesome :))
I am not religious but am very much into meditation and spiritual development. 

I study psychology. 

I'm an Aries. I click well with other fire signs (in friendship as well as romance).

I'm an intellectual and an explorer of life. I long talks about life. And I love laughing. And quite times. I feel friends should be there for each other. 

Friendships are like magic. You don't quite see the moment where an acquaitance becomes a friend. It may be when she brings you soup when you're sick or when you open up about your relationship to her. 

Whatever comes out of this, I wish everyone a happy day and at least 2 true friends in your life.

title: Looking for a mentor...
text:
I do not know what and how to say it .It is kind of ridiculous to be at 41 and need to start your life all over again.I am looking for someone (a mentor,a guide whatever you name it) who has ability and good will to help others.

To make things clear I'm not asking for " a fish ...I'm looking for a fishing-rod".


I'm originally from Poland (I've got American citizenship) male with good manners. Honest and educated staying in Poland as of right now. After years in States I moved back to Poland (a year ago) to take care of my elderly mom.
From the perspective (I'm sorry to say that) that was a huge mistake. All of the sudden my brother and his wife reminded themselves that they got a mother and they became so "loving". Under the circumstances my mom has simply changed her mind and she does not need me anymore . Who would it thought that something like this happens but it happened. I still love her and wish her the best.

Now I need to go back to US and start everything from the beginning. In order to do so, first and foremost I need a job and place to stay. Needless to mention that I lost everything when I had decided to move to Poland (lost my job, sold my condo for almost nothing) 

Despite of everything I still believe that there is a plenty people of good will who can help. 

Maybe you are one of them? Or maybe you are the one who needs a help as well? We can help each other?

Although I worked for a corporation I can be a good Companion, House Manager, and Caregiver.
( actually I'm into that type of mojo after that experience at my mom's ). 
I love to cook and housekeeping is not a problem for me. Things come to me naturally and I learn them pretty quick.


So if you feel like you can help please contact me. While in Europe we can comunicate via Skype.

title: White Guy seeks Black Girl for Fun, Friendship and Good Times
text:
Hey! My name is Mike. I just relocated back to the Ft Lauderdale area and I'm looking to make a new friend.

A little bit about me.....I'm 47, divorced, tall, thin, very clean, in good shape, self employed and don't have any kids. I'm intelligent, loyal, honest, trustworthy, reliable, spontaneous, adventurous, very open minded, completely uninhibited, hysterically funny, a little wild and lots of fun! My interests are varied and random, but I like hot wings & cold beer, shooting pool, amusement parks, Dave & Busters, karaoke, horror movies, The Walking Dead, Criminal Minds. live music, comedy clubs, watching interracial porn (not alone), being outdoors and all kinds of other stuff. I drink, smoke, swear like a sailor and sometimes burp out loud, but I always put the toilet seat down, never scratch myself in public and I'm a blast to hang out with! I'm a little immature for my age and find that I get along better and have a lot more in common with younger women. I don't have any specific age in mind, but definitely prefer someone under 40. Darker skinned women are my color / flavor of choice, whether it's as friends or something else. I know this is the strictly platonic section, but I would be open to more, if it happened.

About you.....single/divorced, under 40, AA, Black, Brown, Caramel, Chocolate, Ebony, Islander, Mixed Race, etc (you get the idea), healthy, fit, in shape, intelligent, honest, reliable, spontaneous, adventurous, very open minded, uninhibited, a little wild and definitely lots of fun! Please take no offense, but if you're out of shape or overweight, we will not click. Kids are cool and they adore me as much as I do them! I love body art (tattoos) and piercings, so if you have them, that's a BIG PLUS :)

I am bold enough to post a pic, so if you're interested, please send 1 or 2 with your response. Also make sure to tell me the area you live in and a little bit about yourself. I dislike drama and love POSITIVE ENERGY! Please change the subject line to HI MIKE so I can weed out the spam. Hope to hear from an awesome girl!!!

title: Looking for a friend...and time will tell?
text:
Not sure if Craigslist is the right venue but I think it is worthwhile to give it a try.

These times are really hard.
We are living in a world where sex is a priority on the very first date. It seems that almost everybody is just interested in spending the night together at the very first time. 

Women and men are categorized for their body shapes and it seems to be an implicit message when meeting someone: " You are looking for the same as I am".

Values? Morals? It's in the past. Almost nobody cares about that. All most people care is to take advantage of someone who wants to be used.

I am taking two risks when writing this ad: number one, to find a nice guy that wants to get to know me for WHO I am and viceversa and number two, to unfortunately run into one of the million of men who abide in this planet.

If number one option works I guarantee an interesting friendship and time will tell? If number two pops up I can detect the symptoms easily and react to it asap.

A little about myself: Latina, Christian (God first) , artistic, well mannered, movie lover.

Some examples of my future friend: Christian, easy going, understanding, cultured (please dont talk about sports all the time!!!)

Wanna find out more? Next chapter, maybe enjoying some coffee.

title: Swolemates
text:
Now you may be asking, "What is a Swolemate" its your life-long gym partner. The one you simply can't lift without. You would never dare let someone else spot you once you've found your true swolemate. You and your swolemate grow together,and lose together,

Okay to the point,summer is around the corner,due to my mom passing and slacking on the gym I need a judgement free gym buddy to help me get my summer body back, I need someone who is willing to motivate me and while at it develop a lovely friendship, I work out monday through friday either really really earlyin the mornings when the gyms empty or late at night (11pm-5am time frame) when no one is there,with the weekends off as my "cheat days" im a vegetarian,so my diet is pretty healthy, Im just trying to cut fat and lose weight, not into bulking, However I can spot you broseph,I gotchu' (up to 145lbs that is) HOWEVER I dont want some rude professional trainer who think they can out gym me, like cool you can lift how much I weigh, anywho, if you're intrested You should send a reply, 

THIS IS NOT FOR HOOKING UP OR ANYTHING LIKE THAT SIMPLY A HEALTHY FRIENDSHIP ANYONE WHO EMAILS ME OTHER WISE WILL BE IGNORED
and if my posting gets flagged because im not a bimbo slag putting out,
Ill keep re posting my ad, until I either meet someone at the gym or on here.

Send me a picture and a reason why you think we'd be amazing sweaty swolemates.

title: Dinner Mon/Tu
text:
Have open evenings Monday/Tuesday, if anyone would like to join me for dinner. I'm early 30s, here on business with some frequency, and am just looking to meet people. I'm laid back, not completely stupid, and not so grotesque that my very company would ruin a meal. I enjoy reading, movies (Save horror, I dislike horror as a genre), board games, video games, anime, and a plethora of other dorky things. Dinner would be on me, obviously, and if at the worst you sit down with me and instantly regret it, you can feel free to fake an emergency, or just let me know you have a very important load of laundry that needs changing immediately, and we'll call it at that. Doral is about the only part of Miami I can get around without a GPS, so something on 87th, for example, is a good spot in my book (Doesn't have to be on 87th... Just thereabouts... as again, I like life without the GPS and horrific traffic).

I don't know any Spanish, really, but if someone wanted to hang out and work on their English, I'm good with that as well. I used to do a lot of ASL tutoring with Korean/Japanese students, so wouldn't be bothered a bit if someone wanted to just come and practice talking.

I'll be leaving to find something worth eating around 19:00 if I don't have responses from anyone Monday (Which is fairly likely given that's an hour from now) and would be available 17:00 or later Tuesday. If interested in either, or possibly interested and have some deep probing questions that would determine that, fire away.

title: looking for a Florida friend
text:
I currently live in Idaho and plan to move to south Florida with in a couple years. That being said this would be a text, phone, email relationship for the most part. However I do travel to Florida a couple times a year. 

About me; 
I'm 37, 6'3" 195. I have two teenage kids that I share custody with my ex. I've been single now almost two years after 15 years of marriage. Married young and dumb. Not looking to make that mistake again. I lived on Ft Myers beach for a couple years and loved it, however this time I'm thinking maybe the east coast would be better. I love a day at the beach and hanging out sharing drinks, jokes and war stories. I'm a liberal when it comes to politics, you don't have to be it might make for some fun debates. I'm not religious at all, and wouldn't get along with someone that is. I'm not college educated, however I'm constantly reading and learning new things so I'm no dummy. I'm a working man and plan on being that for quite sometime. I'm easy going but no doormat. I'm sarcastic and witty, a little goofy at times but I know there's a time and a place. I eat fairly healthy and love to cook and I've won Bbq contests with both my ribs and pulled pork. I'm originally from Kansas, born and raised there and lived there till 2010 when I moved to Florida, then in 2013 moved here to Boise Idaho. I've lived in Seattle as well. I love road trips and seeing new things. 

What I'm looking for;

I know this is the strictly platonic section but just in case it develops into more here's my list.
Age is only a number so let's say 25-55. Prefer that your kids are at least in their teens or none at all. I prefer thicker women, size 12-16 or so. I know I'm being picky but hey it's my ad right. You should be fun and outgoing I'm not the Netflix and chill type. You should like to laugh and have a silly side. Hopefully you enjoy great food and won't turn down a stiff drink. I like opinionated passionate people, not afraid to argue you opinion and have a healthy debate. I don't care about your financial status, money doesn't buy happiness. Hopefully you love the beach and prefer being outside over inside. You should love music and enjoy seeing it live. Think little beach bar with a house band. That's enough for now I suppose. 

If you think you might be a good match and want to learn more about me please reply. Have a fantastic day!

title: I'm trained to leave the toilet seat down!
text:
My name is Matt and I can say with high confidence and certainty that I am unlike ANY other guy out there!

For starters, I am NOT the typical South Florida guy and I pride myself on being anything but "normal or typical".

I stay true to who I really am for the positive and the negative while beating to my own set of drums; snare and tom-tom!

In regards to my attitude, my censorship filter is either turned off or usually broken! 

On the flip side, I also contain a silly, playful, dorky personality & sense of humor with such sayings as you put my Gotta Get Thru This in my Fifth Harmony Work From Home!

My definition of having a good time is going for dinner, feeding the duckies, nature watching, sleepovers, Netflix nights, Starbucks for tea/coffee, working out, mini golf, bowling, playing pool, card games, star gazing, video games (PC, iPhone, iPad, and Android), Lion Country Safari, and Jungle Island (Parrot Jungle).

What I am doing with my life

I own my computer consulting business and have been doing so for ten years. In addition to this, I have been busy learning new computer concepts and self-improving on who I am to myself or others. I am basically going through my own renaissance and looking for a girl who wants to come along for the ride.

I'm really good at

I pride myself on being an amazing giver and show by my actions how I put people on the proverbial pedestal. In addition to this, I also possess the ability to logically find a problem and discover a rational solution in life, people, or computers. I also excel in giving my car weekly baths and making awesome mix mp3 CDs! Furthermore, I believe in giving to others that are less fortunate than I am. Two perfect examples is that I provide to the American Red Cross when natural disasters strike and the Salvation Army sees my old belongings on a periodic basis. Lastly for now, I am a big believer in saving whatever resources are left for others and future generations. Therefore, newspaper, magazines, plastic, steel, cardboard all go in the recycling bin!

The first things people usually notice about me
